discourse_list.title: [Signal Request] Should we take Emergency action to fix the peg?

content.content: The dai peg has been broken since black Thursday, despite a breath taking rally which would normally push dai below $1. Peg issues are largely attributed to yield farming and the recent boom in defi activity. It has been difficult to find adequate levers that governance can pull to improve the peg, but recently the community has rallied around some variant of lowering the USDC LR. At the moment the DC is full for USDC. Any lowering of the LR will be moot unless we raise the USDC debt ceiling as well. Since we also recently onboarded the PAX stablecoin, we will be able to diversify our stablecoin custodial risk by applying similar DC and LR to PAX. I propose we create an emergency executive vote for Monday with one of the following emergency actions: Option 1: 1.01 LR USDC-A LR: 101% USDC-A DC: 200 million PAX LR: 101% PAX DC: 100 million Option 2: 1.05 LR USDC-A LR: 105% USDC-A DC: 200 million PAX LR: 105% PAX DC: 100 million Should we take Emergency action to fix the peg?     Yes, ranked vote of LR Yes, Option 1 (1.01 LR) Yes, Option 2 (1.05 LR) No Abstain     0 voters     More discussion on this topic here: [Signal Request] Dai is at 1.04, going towards 1.05. Should we fix the peg with an emergency vote to lower stablecoin LR and increase stablecoin DC? - #32 by befitsandpiper  In order for this to be put into the executive on Monday, we will need at least 40 voters, and at least a 50% majority in favor of the action as per the emergency process here: Emergency / Urgent Governance Process
content.GPT-summary: The author proposes an emergency executive vote to fix the broken dai peg by lowering the USDC LR and increasing the USDC debt ceiling. The proposal includes two options for the LR and DC of both USDC and PAX. The author also provides a link for more discussion on the topic. A 50% majority in favor of the action is required for the proposal to be put into the executive on Monday. Some third parties are asking questions and giving constructive criticism on the proposal.

content.content: I voted no for the following reasons;  LR at this point does not have a high impact on dai generation from USDC-A, I think DC will get filled at 110% (the vault was highly utilized also at higher LR levels). We do know that lowering LR to 101% is a high risk move both in just pure numbers and both on the philosophical level. Additional 60M USDC-A DC will be available soon, I think we should first observe the outcome of this increase before doing other changes. This request equates PAX with USDC, which is clearly not the case by any means. PAX was added very recently and due to the fact that PAX holders did not interact with DeFi historically, I think we should give them more time. There is only 150M PAX effectively in circulation (130M is held by PAX treasury), I dont think we need a 100M DC. Do we expect that the majority of PAX in circulation will go into Maker as collateral, I dont think this is something Maker should allow. Reversing the 101% change is very hard in a non capital distorting way for some stakeholder of the system or creating high pressure on dai. Current DeFi financial markets have new dynamics which are not present in traditional fin markets due to AMMs. Due to several different liquidity mining schemes (Curve, Swerve, Sushi + other food tokens), AMMs are highly liquid, which means actual circulation of units has a heavy impact on the price (there is 2B USDC and almost 9B USDT on Ethereum). The effect is clearly visible across “domestic stablecoins to Ethereum”, which all trade with a high premium relative to “foreign stablecoins”. Good example is sUSD from Synthetix (~98M units in circulation) which traded at $1.05 just hours ago.
